properties.areaDesc: Jones, GA; Twiggs, GA; Monroe, GA; Bibb, GA; Houston, GA
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 9:24PM EST until January 19 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia...

Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Bibb...Houston...Jones...
Monroe and Twiggs Counties

Oconee River near Penfield affecting Clarke...Greene and Oconee
Counties

Oconee River near Oconee affecting Johnson...Washington and
Wilkinson Counties

Oconee River near Oconee affecting Washington and Wilkinson
Counties

Little River near Washington affecting Taliaferro and Wilkes
Counties

The Flood Warning continues for
The Ocmulgee River near Macon.
* Until Sunday morning.
* At 830 PM Tuesday the stage was 21.5 feet and rising.
* Minor flooding is occurring, and minor flooding is forecast to
continue.
* Flood stage is 18 feet.
* The river will continue rising, reaching near 22.8 feet by early
Thursday morning. The river is forecast to fall below flood stage
Sunday morning.
* At 21 feet, minor flooding expands with an increasing amount of the
Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail flooding north of the Martin
Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be up to two
feet deep on portions of the trail and both banks overflow upstream
from the bridge. Large portions of agricultural lands east of Macon
and well downstream will be under 1 to 4 feet of water.

At 23 feet, minor flooding expands further with large portions of
the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail flooded north of the
Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be up to
3 feet deep on portions of the trail. Large portions of agricultural
lands east of Macon and well downstream will be under up to 5 feet
of water.

NWSheadline: Flood Warning extended until Sunday morning
